flow

Class Flow

  • java.lang.Object
    • flow.Flow

  • public final class Flow
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds the current truth, the history of screens, and exposes operations to change it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Flow.Direction 
      static interface  Flow.Dispatcher 
      static class  Flow.Traversal 
      static interface  Flow.TraversalCallback
      Supplied by Flow to the Listener, which is responsible for calling onComplete().

        public static boolean isFlowSystemService(java.lang.String name)

      • getHistory

        public History getHistory()

      • setDispatcher

        public void setDispatcher(Flow.Dispatcher dispatcher)
        Set the dispatcher, may receive an immediate call to Flow.Dispatcher.dispatch(flow.Flow.Traversal, flow.Flow.TraversalCallback). If a Traversal is currently in progress with a previous Dispatcher, that Traversal will not be affected.

      • removeDispatcher

        public void removeDispatcher(Flow.Dispatcher dispatcher)
        Remove the dispatcher. A noop if the given dispatcher is not the current one.

        No further Traversals, including Traversals currently enqueued, will execute until a new dispatcher is set.

      • setHistory

        public void setHistory(History history,
              Flow.Direction direction)
        Replaces the history with the one given and dispatches in the given direction.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.Object newTop)
        Updates the history such that the given object is at the top and dispatches the updated history. If newTop is already at the top of the history, the history will be unchanged, but it will be dispatched with direction Flow.Direction.REPLACE. If newTop is already on the history but not at the top, the stack will pop until newTop is at the top, and the dispatch direction will be Flow.Direction.BACKWARD. If newTop is not already on the history, it will be pushed and the dispatch direction will be Flow.Direction.FORWARD. Objects equality is always checked using Object.equals(Object).

      • goBack

        public boolean goBack()
        Go back one screen.
        Returns:
        false if going back is not possible.
